title: Citi to Sell Egg Mortgage and Savings Business to Yorkshire Building Society
summary: London – Citi today announced that its subsidiary Egg Banking plc has entered into an agreement to sell its Egg and Pi-branded Mortgage and Savings Business, along with the Egg and Pi Brands, to Yorkshire Building Society. The £2.5billion* savings book and £430 million* mortgage book represent approximately 550,000 customers.
tag-1: Citi to Sell Egg Mortgage and Savings Business to Yorkshire Building Society
tag-2: London – Citi today announced that its subsidiary Egg Banking plc has entered into an agreement to sell its Egg and Pi-branded Mortgage and Savings Business, along with the Egg and Pi Brands, to Yorkshire Building Society. The £2.5billion* savings book and £430 million* mortgage book represent approximately 550,000 customers.
tag-3: On completion of the transaction, Egg savers and borrowers will become members of Yorkshire Building Society, the UK's second-largest building society, which is a strong financial institution committed to excellent customer service and good, long-term value products.
tag-4: Citi is committed to working with Yorkshire Building Society on a seamless transfer of the customer accounts and continuation of the high level of service to which customers are accustomed.
tag-5: This is the third major divestiture relating to Egg, and follows the sale of its personal installment loan portfolio and of its credit cards portfolio, which completed in Q2.
tag-6: The sale demonstrates Citi's continued success in reducing the assets and businesses within Citi Holdings in an economically rational manner, while working to generate long-term profitability and growth from the core businesses within Citicorp. Citi has reduced assets within Citi Holdings by more than $500 billion since the peak in the first quarter of 2008.
tag-7: Other terms of the sale were not disclosed. The transaction is not expected to be material to Citi's net income. The transaction is expected to close in Q4, subject to High Court approval in the United Kingdom and other customary conditions.
tag-8: The transaction does not affect Citibank's retail offering in the UK, nor Citi's UK Capital Markets, Institutional Banking and Global Transaction Services businesses, which will continue to provide an unparalleled global footprint and services to its clients, including major companies, financial institutions and the public sector, as well as subsidiaries of foreign multinational companies.
tag-9: Citi's Institutional Clients Group advised Citi on the transaction.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-12: Yorkshire Building Society Yorkshire Building Society, which has its head office based in Bradford, is the UK's second largest building society with approximately 2.6 million members, 178 branches and assets of over £30bn. It has recently successfully merged with Barnsley Building Society (31/12/08) and Chelsea Building Society (1/04/2010). Yorkshire Building Society has also announced a merger with Norwich & Peterborough Building Society (N&P) which, subject to a vote of N&P members and confirmation by the FSA, is expected to complete on 1st November 2011.
tag-13: Yorkshire Building Society reported very strong financial performance for the year ended 31 December 2010, with the Society announcing a significant increase in profits, a robust capital position and an increase in new members.
